prompt_final_to_llm:
You are an analytical historian of Artificial Intelligence. Describe how the concept evolved across time, highlighting paradigm shifts, milestones, and key theoretical transformations. Present findings in a coherent historical narrative ordered strictly by explicit *event years* found in the snippets. If a snippet provides no explicit event year, you MUST write '(event year not stated; described in YEAR PDF [n])'. Never guess or estimate historical periods under any circumstances. Avoid enumeration; emphasize causal relations and conceptual transitions. Use numeric IEEE-style citations [1], [2], etc., for statements supported by the provided snippets. Each number corresponds to one unique PDF listed below. Multiple snippets originating from the same PDF share the same number. Never assign multiple citation numbers to the same source.

**Your final answer MUST end with a separate section titled 'References'.**
This section MUST list all unique PDFs exactly once, in the following strict format:
[n] FILENAME.pdf (YEAR)

Do not fabricate author names, journals, or article titles — only use the given filename and metadata year.

Temporal Attribution Rules:
1. You may ONLY use event years that appear explicitly in the snippet text.
2. If the snippet text explicitly contains a year (e.g., 'In the 1950s', 'In 1976'), treat that as the factual historical reference.
3. If a snippet DOES NOT contain an explicit event year, you MUST NOT guess, infer, approximate, or estimate any year.
   Instead, write exactly: '(event year not stated; described in YEAR PDF [n])'.
4. The metadata publication year indicates only when the PDF was published, not when the events occurred.
5. Never replace or override an explicit event year with a metadata year.
6. Never deduce approximate historical periods from textual content (e.g., never infer '1990s' unless explicitly stated).

Output Structuring Guidelines:
- For every key historical or conceptual point:
  • If an explicit event year exists in the snippet → include it.
  • If no explicit event year exists → write '(event year not stated; described in YEAR PDF [n])'.
- Recommended dual-year structure:
  • (1950s; described in 2025 PDF [7]) The Turing Test was proposed as a benchmark.
This dual timestamping ensures full temporal grounding without hallucination.

IMPORTANT:
**Your output MUST end with a final section titled 'References'.**
This section must list all unique PDFs exactly once in IEEE numeric format.

model_output:
The historical evolution and influence of data availability on AI methodologies can be traced as follows:

1. (event year not stated; described in 2006 PDF [1]) The introduction of interactive exhibits focusing on artificial intelligence (AI) marked a public interest in the field, laying the groundwork for increased focus and investment in AI research. 2. (event year not stated; described in 2016 PDF [2]) The emergence of knowledge-based expert systems indicated the importance of preserving and distributing know-how, demonstrating an emphasis on utilizing data effectively in AI methodologies. 3. (event year not stated; described in 2022 PDF [3]) The advent of perturbation-based methods for text manipulation showcased a shift towards more adaptable AI models that could handle different types and forms of data, fostering improved performance on tasks requiring expertise. 4. (event year not stated; described in 2023 PDF [4]) The rapid progress and diversity of techniques in transfer learning highlighted the need for understanding the space of existing methods to compare and tease apart new contributions effectively, underlining the significance of data availability in driving advancements in AI. 5. (event year not stated; described in 2024 PDF [5]) The superior performance of supervised models over zero-shot models demonstrated the value of large datasets for training intelligent AI models capable of reasoning and inferencing effectively. 6. (2025; described in 2025 PDF [6]) The advent of language model-based agents for statistics and data science facilitated a new paradigm in education, allowing professors to create interactive workflows for lessons through natural language interaction, underscoring the role of data in creating user-friendly AI tools. 7. (event year not stated; described in 2025 PDF [7]) The evolution of GPT-series models over the years demonstrates a continuous effort to improve and refine AI technologies based on the available data, as shown by the schematic diagram provided in Figure 4. 8. (event year not stated; described in 2025 PDF [8]) The success of AI in various fields, such as image recognition, speech recognition, drug analysis, and DNA mutation prediction, demonstrates the transformative potential of AI when equipped with sufficient data for training. References:
[1] 1887-Article Text-1883-1-10-20080129.pdf (2006)
[2] Expert_Systems.pdf (2016)
[3] 2201.05273v4.pdf (2022)
[4] 1910.10683v4.pdf (2023)
[5] 3641289.pdf (2024)
[6] A Survey on Large Language Model-based Agents for Statistics and Data Science.pdf (2025)
[7] 2303.18223v16.pdf (2025)
[8] NatureDeepReview.pdf (2025)
